div.p:
—Amidst the
plains of North America some powerful nation,
which has disappeared, constructed circular, square,
and octagonal fortifications; walls, 6000 toises in
length; tumuli, from 700 to 800 feet in diameter,
and 140 feet in height, sometimes round, sometimes
with several stories, and containing thousands of
skeletons. These skeletons are the remains of men
less slender and more squat than the present inhab-
itants of those countries. On a vast space of ground
at the Lower Orinoco, as well as on the banks of
the Casiquiare, and between the sources of the Es-
sequibo and the Rio Branco, there are rocks of
granite covered with symbolic figures. These sculp-
tures denote that the extinct generations belonged
to nations different from those which now inhabit
the same region.—Humboldt’s Travels
